Title:
Two new Conidiobolus species with microconidia from
China
Abstract:
Two new Conidiobolus species, were isolated from Anhui and
Shandong provinces, China. A polyphasic taxonomic approach comprising
morphylogical characters and molecular data (the nuclear large subunit
ribosomal DNA and the translation elongation factor 1 alpha gene
sequences) was applied to determine their novel taxonomic status in the
genus Conidiobolus. C. yantianshanensis is phylogenetically related to
C. khandalensis (ATCC15162), and it can be differed from C. khandalensis
by its larger primary conidia. C. drechslerii is closed to C. gonimodes
(ATCC14445) in the phylogenetic tree, and C. drechslerii is
morphologically different from C. gonimodes by its larger primary
conidia and two types of microconidia. Both species are genetically
distinct from morphylogically related species revealed by phylogenetic
analyses.
